page.title: 13Farming, Cotton End
page.content: In the Autumn many of the fields have been ploughed after harvesting. Among the crops grownare Winter Wheat, Oilseed Rape,Winter Barley, Spring Beans, Lucerne and Maize. Some fields are laid to grass and sheep and cows may be seen grazing here. A mixed variety of fruit and vegetables including sweetcorn and pumpkins may be found at the "pick your own" Farm on the A600 Bedford to Hitchin road. Most of the woodlandis part of the Samuel Whitbread Estate. The mature timber is mainly blocks of amenity trees with most of the plantation having been replanted within the last thirty years. Mechanical, hand or spray weeding is used to clear the young plantations. All the timber from the woodland is sold to Southill Saw Mills which produce a wide variety of fencing material.
